docs.lead_paragraph: FRENCH fries and mozzarella sticks washed down with a can of Coke. Skittles and a cool, slushy, fruit-flavored drink. Throughout the state's 600 public school districts, this will soon be history. In many of them, it already is. Alarmed by the rise in student obesity, New Jersey is putting school cafeterias on a diet.
docs.snippet: Many school districts get a head start in making school meals healthier.

docs.lead_paragraph: THIS summer, the nation grieved in advance for Brennan Hawkins, an 11-year-old Boy Scout lost in the Utah wilderness. But the boy was rescued four days after he disappeared, and his searchers might have found him earlier -- had he not run from them. His family had taught him to avoid strangers, and he was afraid of being abducted. Brennan's fear is a familiar one for many parents living on Long Island and in Westchester County, especially in communities that have been touched by a child's abduction or murder. But we must weigh the real dangers in our neighborhoods against other, more subtle, costs to the well-being of our children. It is a task that's both difficult and essential.
docs.snippet: THIS summer, the nation grieved in advance for Brennan Hawkins, an 11-year-old Boy Scout lost in the Utah wilderness. But the boy was rescued four days after he disappeared, and his searchers might have found him earlier -- had he not run from them....

headline.main: In Survey, Executives Recount Travails of Menopause Symptoms

docs.lead_paragraph: When menopausal hot flashes caused sweat to run down Donna Cook's face at business meetings, she joked to concerned colleagues, ''I'm having my personal summer.'' But for executives like Ms. Cook, menopause symptoms like profuse sweating, nasty mood swings and memory lapses are not funny.
docs.snippet: For business executives, menopause symptoms like profuse sweating, nasty mood swings and memory lapses are not funny.

docs.lead_paragraph: THIS summer, the nation grieved in advance for Brennan Hawkins, an 11-year-old Boy Scout lost in the Utah wilderness. But the boy was rescued four days after he disappeared, and his searchers might have found him earlier -- had he not run from them. His family had taught him to avoid strangers, and he was afraid of being abducted. Brennan's fear is a familiar one for many parents living on Long Island and in Westchester County, especially in communities that have been touched by a child's abduction or murder. But we must weigh the real dangers in our neighborhoods against other, more subtle, costs to the well-being of our children. It is a task that's both difficult and essential.
docs.snippet: Fear of strangers is keeping children from the great outdoors.

docs.lead_paragraph: THE waiting room at the office of Dr. Stanley Title on West 57th Street in Manhattan is full of women, all of them seeking a cure for fat. It is a man's job in life to make money, but ''a woman has to look good,'' said Dr. Title, explaining why the women flock to his office, where the walls are decorated with framed articles from newspapers and magazines that quote him as a leading weight-loss expert.
docs.snippet: As obesity becomes an increasingly intractable problem, some diet doctors are testing the boundaries of accepted practices.

legacy.MultimediaSummary3: Diet drugs have a turbulent history, and the consumer advocacy group Public Citizen warns that there is littleevidence that any will promote long-term weight reduction and control.

multimedia.caption: A Guide to Weight-Loss Drugs
multimedia.credit: Diet drugs have a turbulent history, and the consumer advocacy group Public Citizen warns that there is littleevidence that any will promote long-term weight reduction and control.
